texts.label: Highlights
texts.content:
• Iconic Byzantine Revival–style Eastern Orthodox church
  • Once the largest Eastern Orthodox church in the world
  • Built in memory of Russian soldiers who died in the Russo-Turkish War, whose sacrifice contributed to Bulgaria’s independence
  • Named after an ancient Russian prince who defended his realm against invasions by the Swedes and the Teutonic Knights, securing the role of Eastern Orthodoxy in Eastern Europe

texts.label: History
texts.content: St. Alexander Nevsky Cathedral is a stunning example of Neo-Byzantine architecture...

texts.label: Experience
texts.content: Walking around Sofia, you'll find charming streets and local cafes...
